title: Vartalap - Let's Talk: Balancing Books and Being

extendedProps.description: This month's Vartalap session, titled 'BALANCING BOOKS AND BEING: Growing Through Change in Academic Life', is a reflective session dedicated to helping students navigate transitions, support mental wellness, and find steadiness in academic life. Part of a monthly expert-led series on mental health and wellness, Vartalap provides a space to pause, listen, and explore themes like well-being, relationships, and personal growth through honest conversation, not a lecture. It is open to all students, whether new or established.

Ms. Rama Bijapurkar will deliver a lecture on Understanding India’s Household Consumption Story.

Krittika, the Astronomy Club of IIT Bombay, invites you to a Q&A panel discussion for all those curious about turning their passion for astronomy and astrophysics into a career. Learn about the diverse paths the field offers, hear firsthand experiences from those who’ve pursued it and get your questions answered by professionals in the domain. Meet Our Panelists: - Gaurav Waratkar – Postdoctoral researcher at Caltech, specializing in high-energy astrophysics, astronomical instrumentation, and gravitational wave transients. - Praveer Tiwari – Postdoctoral researcher at IIT Bombay, with expertise in supermassive black holes, gravitational waves, and nuclear astrophysics. - Yogesh Wagh – PhD at Liverpool John Moores University (LJMU), working on near-Earth asteroid detection, gamma-ray burst (GRB) afterglows, and scheduling algorithms for gravitational wave follow-ups. - Sameer Patil – Phd at STARLAB, he is a technologist turned Astrophysicist with 25 years of software experience at firms like Morgan Stanley, MCSI and Google, he is now doing research in 21 cm cosmology, GRBs and use of AI/ML techniques in Astrophysics.
extendedProps.organisingBody: Krittika, the Astronomy Club of IIT Bombay

title: NSS Department Orientation for NOCS students

extendedProps.description: Greetings from NSS IIT Bombay! Are you ready to step into a journey that blends purpose with passion? To introduce you to the joy of volunteering and making real-world impact, NSS IIT Bombay is conducting a Department Orientation. This session will walk you through our wide range of initiatives, show you how each department contributes to meaningful change, and help you find your place in this movement. Mandatory for all freshers who selected NSS as NOCS 1st or 2nd preference. Others who are curious and passionate are warmly welcome too! Exciting freebies await you… But the real reward? Discovering how you can help change lives — starting with your own. Join the WhatsApp group for regular updates about the same - https://chat.whatsapp.com/GUajfMHNYliFHMNVVOOsAK

Expect exciting surprises and a memorable session, perfect for beginners and curious minds.

title: Joy of Discovery in the Modern Era : Some Reflections and Directions

extendedProps.description: About the Speaker: Prof. B. Ananthanarayan is a professor and former chair of the center for High Energy Physics at the Indian Institute of Science. He obtained his B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering from IIT Madras in 1985 (as part of the last five year batch) and completed his M.S. and Ph.D. from the University of Delaware, USA, 1988 and 1991, respectively. After post-doctoral work at the Physical Research Laboratory (PRL) in Ahmedabad, University of Lausanne and Bern, he joined IISc in 1996 and has been there ever since. His research spans several areas of elementary particle physics and field theory. Additionally, he has been involved in editorial work for Springer for over a decade and a half and is well known for his outreach efforts through writings and popular talks. BA was Homi Bhabha Fellow, 2009-2011, was awarded the Rustom Choksi Award for Excellence in Science, 2014 by IISc, held the MSIL Chair of the Division of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, IISc. BA was Chair of CHEP for a record period of over 9 years and 7 months. He is presently on the Governing Council of the IUAC, Delhi, and serves on the India-CERN Task Force of the DAE and DST, and has been recently inducted into the advisory committee for the dual degree of IIIT Hyderabad. Speaker's webpage: https://chep.iisc.ac.in/Personnel/pages/anant/index.html Abstract: In this talk, we shall discuss the project of knowledge production as a profession and as a career, and the calling of a professional. We will present general arguments by looking into some contemporary examples drawn from different disciplines. We will described at a popular level recent discoveries such as gravitational waves which unites physics at the largest and smallest scales and the discovery of the Higgs boson which required a heroic man made machine. We will appeal to other examples from mathematics, computer science, biology, climate science, to name a few to motivate the challenges of the present era. We will also look into the issues of the psychology of creativity. Of importance are also questions of science and engineering in India as a developing country and that of representation of women among others. We will also touch on important issues of the role of the individual, of working in teams, and of communication. Stated differently this talk aims to provide a motivational framework and spells out the gestalt needed for a young person to enter the daunting field of research and discovery and to be a part of the great discoveries that lie ahead. The talk is aimed at a very broad audience and is accessible even to class XI and XII students, and for students across all B. Tech, M.Sc, Ph.D. students in all branches of sciences, and also to teachers and researchers in all areas of science. The speaker is well suited for this as someone with experience in both engineering and science. We wish to leave a lot of time for discussion at the end of the talk and encourage participation from all, young and not so young.
extendedProps.venue: Room No. 22, 2nd floor, VMCC, IIT Bombay
extendedProps.contact: Falguni Banerjee Naha, Public Relations Officer, Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Tel: (+91-22) 25767026-27

extendedProps.description: Revised schedule for the Independence Day Programme 2025: 08.55 am: The Director arrives at the venue. 08.59 am: The Director proceeds to the dais. 09.00 am: The Director hoists the National Flag, and the National Anthem follows. 09.05 am: Address by the Director. 09.10 am: Address by the Chief Guest, Shri Rajiv M. Pandia, Distinguished alumnus. 09.15 am: Felicitation of the two longest serving employees by the Director & the Chief guest. 09.20 am: Cultural Programme. Followed by Staff Excellence award function at B Nag Auditorium, VMCC. All are invited to attend the above events. Those who are unable to attend the Independence Day celebrations can participate virtually by watching the live web-casting available at the link below: https://www.youtube.com/c/IITBombayOfficialChannel

title: Gram Bhraman: A Rural Exploration Camp & Field Visit to Mamnoli

extendedProps.description: The Group for Rural Activities (GRA) invites you to 'Gram Bhraman', an extraordinary rural exploration camp and field visit to Mamnoli, Kalyan, scheduled for 17th August, 2025. This immersive experience offers a dive into village life amidst lush greenery, alongside insights from Samatol foundation, an NGO working in child rehabilitation. Participants will engage in village exploration, a round table discussion with Vijay Jadhav (founder of Samatol foundation), and direct interaction with children rehabilitated by Samatol. Samatol foundation aims to reunite abandoned/orphaned kids with their families, having successfully reunited over 15000 children. Note: This initiative is not for UG Freshers (2025 UG entrants).

The primary objective is to foster a culture of reading and promote the acquisition of enlightening and valuable books. Publishers and vendors are offering generous discounts of up to 50%.
extendedProps.venue: First Floor of the Central Library

extendedProps.description: Major is a moving tribute to Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, the braveheart who laid down his life during the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. The film beautifully portrays his journey -- from his childhood dreams to his heroic final mission -- and reminds us of the true meaning of service to the nation. This screening is not just about watching a film; it's about honoring a hero and reflecting on the values of duty, bravery, and selflessness. We encourage everyone to join us, bring along your friends, and immerse yourselves in a story that will leave you inspired and proud. Let's make this Independence Day truly memorable.

Attendees will gain access to powerful leadership-class compute cluster systems with latest GPU architecture, NVIDIA and partner mentors, and certificates.

extendedProps.description: The Student Wellness Centre (SWC) conducts an annual Wellbeing Questionnaire (WBQ) for all first-year UG students to support their well-being and ease adjustment to campus life. Participation is mandatory. Students are divided into batches with specific time slots: Batch 1 (10:00 am - 11:00 am): D1-T1, D2-T1, D3-T1, D4-T1 and D1-T2, D2-T2; Batch 2 (11:00 am - 12:00 pm): D3-T2, D4-T2 and D1-T3, D2-T3, D3-T3, D4-T3; Batch 3 (12:00 pm - 1:00 pm): D1-T4, D2-T4, D3-T4, D4-T4 and D1-T5 D2-T5; Batch 4 (2:30 pm - 3:30 pm): D3-T5, D4-T5 and D1-T6, D2-T6, D3-T6, D4-T6; Batch 5 (3:30 pm - 4:30 pm): D1-T7, D2-T7, D3-T7, D4-T7 and D1-T8, D2-T8; Batch 6 (4:30 pm - 5:30 pm): D3-T8, D4-T8 and D1-T9, D2-T9, D3-T9, D4-T9; Batch 7 (5:30 pm - 6:30 pm): B.Des.

title: National Level Online Quiz: Independence Day

extendedProps.description: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS), under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution, Government of India, is organizing a National Level Online Quiz exclusively for BIS MoU partner institutes to test knowledge and celebrate the spirit of Independence Day.

We are pleased to announce the upcoming edition of the UPSC Talks, an event designed to provide valuable insights into one of India's most prestigious and challenging examinations, the UPSC Civil Services Examination. The session will feature distinguished IIT Bombay alumni, who will share their personal journeys, preparation strategies, and perspectives on serving the nation through the civil services. Attendees can expect direct guidance from alumni, interactive Q&A, practical insights into preparation, and networking opportunities with peers and mentors.
extendedProps.organisingBody: Student Alumni Relations Cell, IIT Bombay
extendedProps.contact: Parth Dhruv (SARC CTM): 99049 59162, Sarvagya Jain (SARC CTM): 94248 00631

title: Sohrai Folk Art Workshop - Roots 10th Birthday Celebration

extendedProps.description: As part of Roots’ 10th Anniversary celebrations, this Independence Day, we invite you to an exclusive Sohrai Folk Art workshop & exhibition led by Ms. Vidisha Pandey, a master of this beautiful tribal tradition. All materials will be provided, just bring your creativity! Join us as we celebrate a decade of nurturing India’s classical and folk arts within our institute, and immerse yourself in the colors of tradition this Independence Day.
extendedProps.organisingBody: Roots – Institute Classical and Folk Arts Club

extendedProps.description: The IIT Bombay Staff Excellence Awards will be conferred to the awardees on 15 August 2025 following the Independence Day celebrations. Consistent and silent contributions of our non-teaching officers and staff are strong support to sustained excellence of IIT Bombay. In order to appreciate and recognize their efforts, you are cordially invited to IITB Staff Excellence Awards Function to felicitate the first batch of awardees. We look forward to your participation in celebrating the consistent contributions of our non-teaching officers and staff.
extendedProps.venue: B Nag Auditorium, VMCC Ground Floor

extendedProps.description: Practice sessions and selection trials for various sports (Athletics, Badminton, Basketball, Chess, Cricket, Football, Hockey, Lawn Tennis, Squash, Table Tennis, Volleyball, Weightlifting) to identify and nurture promising athletes for the 58th Inter-IIT Sports Meet. Students must register via the provided Google Form and adhere to sport-specific instructions.
extendedProps.venue: Multiple venues across IIT Bombay campus as per sport (e.g., Athletics synthetic track, Indoor badminton court, New SAC, Football Turf)
extendedProps.contact: Rajwardhan Toraskar, General Secretary, Sports Affairs, IIT Bombay; Phone: +91 9619000065; Website: gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/sports/

extendedProps.description: The HPCL-IITB Energy Transition Challenge, jointly organized by Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), the Research Hub for Green Energy and Sustainability (GESH IITB), and the Centre of Excellence in Oil, Gas, and Energy (CoE-OGE IITB), aims to engage bright minds like students, startups, researchers, and refinery professionals in ideating practical, scalable, and disruptive solutions for decarbonizing refinery operations and processes. The theme is "Energy Transition in Refineries through Innovation". Participants can win cash prizes up to ₹60,000. Eligibility for Track 1 includes startups and students from IITs, participating as individuals or in teams of up to 4 members.
extendedProps.organisingBody: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), Research Hub for Green Energy and Sustainability (GESH IITB), Centre of Excellence in Oil, Gas, and Energy (CoE-OGE IITB)

title: Tools of Analytics: Power BI Workshop

extendedProps.description: We're excited to host a workshop on Power BI, a powerful business intelligence tool that transforms raw data into interactive dashboards and actionable insights. This session will cover Power BI fundamentals - data import, cleaning, visualization, dashboard creation and will showcase real world industry applications. The workshop will be conducted by Mr. Arijit Chowdhury, Senior VP at YES Bank. Drawing on his hands-on expertise, he will share best practices, tips, and tricks to help you make the most of Power BI’s features. The session will be followed by a certification assignment intended to assess the understanding of topics discussed. Participants who successfully complete the assignment will be awarded a certificate of completion.
extendedProps.contact: Aryan Kashyap, Manager, Analytics Club, 6206443759, analyticsclub@iitb.ac.in

title: Extended services of SWC: Counsellor on call

extendedProps.description: Counsellor on call will be available for one-on-one emotional support. Students can walk in to the SWC office or contact via phone (Institute extension 9070) or email (wellness@iitb.ac.in).
extendedProps.venue: SWC Office (Nandan Nilekani Main Building, 3rd floor)

title: Team ChemEca IIT Bombay Recruitment Test

extendedProps.description: Recruitment test for motivated UG Sophomores to join Team ChemEca IIT Bombay. The test aims to assess basic understanding of PCM subjects, thoughtfulness, resourcefulness, and problem-solving ability. Prior knowledge or experience is not required. Candidates can attempt tests for multiple subsystems. Shortlisted candidates will proceed to interview rounds. Participants are required to bring their laptops.

extendedProps.description: Krittika - the Astronomy Club of IIT Bombay, invites you all to the Krittika Summer Projects (KSP) 6.0 presentation session. Every summer, we run a range of exciting astrophysics projects through KSP – one of the largest student-led programs of its kind in the country. This year’s edition brought together passionate mentees and mentors to explore diverse and challenging topics in astronomy and astrophysics. The following are the specific domains of research covered: 1. Gamma Ray Bursts: Theory and Data Analysis 2. Imaging a Bright Neutron Star and a Magnificent Radio Galaxy 3. Design and analysis of radomes for next-generation radio astronomy experiments 4. Thermonuclear Bursts in Neutron Star X-ray Binaries 5. Visualising Geodesics in Schwarzschild Spacetime 6. Bangs, Blips, or Background: Decoding GRB Signals. Now, after weeks of learning, collaboration, and discovery, our mentees are ready to present their work! Come witness their journey, engage with the projects, and celebrate the spirit of curiosity that drives our community.
extendedProps.venue: Online: Meeting link: https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZGI5MThmMzItMmM2NC00NDZhLTk1MDEtNjRjNGM3Mjk4YjQ2%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22403ee5f4-55b3-45cd-8ae2-824be887a075%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22a234b6fb-6003-48d1-a688-57463bca0bf7%22%7d, Meeting ID: 435 257 550 894 3, Passcode: sd2KK2As

title: Registrations Open for Salsa Night 2025 Opening Performances

extendedProps.description: Registrations for the Opening Performances are now open for UG Sophomores and PG Freshers. This is your chance to be a part of one of the most magical nights of the year and showcase your talent on stage!

title: Central Library Book and e-Book Exhibition cum sale

extendedProps.description: Central Library is excited to announce a spectacular Book and e-Book Exhibition scheduled to run for seven consecutive days from 18th to 24th August 2025. This literary extravaganza will take place on the First Floor of the Central Library. During this exhibition, esteemed Publishers and Vendors from various domains will come together to showcase an extensive collection of cutting-edge publications across a wide spectrum of subjects: a) Engineering, Sciences, and Technology b) Bio-Sciences, Bio-engineering, and Bio-technology c) Economics and Management d) Humanities and other Social Sciences e) Arts and Design f) General collections, encompassing novels, biographies, and more g) Children's Books, sourced from reputable Publishers, including Universities, Professional Societies, and Associations. The primary objective of this book exhibition is to foster a culture of reading and promote the acquisition of enlightening and valuable books. As a special offer, publishers and vendors are offering generous discounts of up to 50%. Users are encouraged to avail themselves of this remarkable opportunity, whether for personal purchase or to recommend titles for inclusion in the library's collection. Join us at the Central Library's Book and e-Book Exhibition and embark on a journey through the world of knowledge and imagination. Don't miss out on the chance to explore, discover, and enrich your personal and academic pursuits. We look forward to welcoming you from 18-24 August 2025 at the First Floor of the Central Library. Opening Day (18 August 2025): 11:00 am - 8:00 pm. 19-24 August 2025: 10:00 am - 8:00 pm. The following publishers and vendors will be participating in the Print/Electronic resources Exhibition/display and sale. Print Books Publishers/Vendors: Feel Books (P) Ltd (Print + Online), Millennium Enterprises, Overseas Press India Pvt. Ltd, T. V. Enterprises, Vakratund Book House, CBS Publishers and Distributors Pvt. Ltd., Sita Books, Packt, New Age International (P) Ltd. Online Publishers/Vendors: Balani Infotech Pvt. Ltd., IOP Publishing Ltd., BSB Edge, Wolters Kluwer, Pearson India Education Services Pvt. Ltd.
extendedProps.venue: First Floor of the Central Library

title: HSBC Session on Careers in Banking and Case Competition Workshop

extendedProps.description: Registrations are open for Zumba and Pilates classes offered by the Institute Sports Council. Zumba is a high-energy fitness program combining music with dance moves, designed to improve cardiovascular health, coordination, and overall fitness. Pilates focuses on strengthening the body with an emphasis on core stability, posture, flexibility, and controlled movement. Both programs are suitable for beginners and experienced fitness enthusiasts and will run Mon-Wed-Fri.
extendedProps.venue: Screening room, 3rd floor (New SAC, opp. Hostel-11)

title: MoU signing between SINE IITB and Monash University

extendedProps.description: The MoU will signal the launch of a partnership committed to supporting start-up talent, commercialisation opportunities, and to strengthen ties between Australia and India’s start-up ecosystem and innovation networks.

We’re excited to announce the start of regular Calisthenics sessions, open to everyone looking to build strength, improve flexibility, and master bodyweight training. Whether you're a beginner or experienced in fitness, these sessions will guide you through structured routines including push-ups, pull-ups, squats, core training, and skill progressions like muscle-ups and levers – all with minimal equipment.
extendedProps.venue: Screening room, 3rd floor (New SAC, opp. H11)

extendedProps.description: The Institute Sports Council invites you to experience Teqball, a modern sport combining football and table tennis elements, played on a curved Teq table. It can be played in singles or doubles, testing skill and reflexes by passing the ball with any body part except hands and arms.

title: Inter IIT Aquatics Girls Swimming Trials

extendedProps.description: The Aquatics Club of IIT Bombay will be conducting girls swimming trials as part of the pre-camp selections for the upcoming Inter IIT Aquatics Meet. These trials present a valuable opportunity to be a part of the IIT Bombay contingent and compete at the Inter IIT Sports Meet. Selected students will undergo structured training and gain exposure to high-level competition while representing IIT Bombay. The Inter IIT Aquatics Meet will be held from 30th September to 4th October 2025 at IIT Madras, as part of the Inter IIT Sports Meet.
extendedProps.venue: Institute Swimming Pool (in front of Hostel 2)

extendedProps.description: The Institute Sports Council is organizing a Swimming Preparatory Camp, part of an ongoing series of Aquatics Camps, to teach swimming. The camp runs from August 25th to September 4th. It offers three distinct sessions: an Intermediate Camp (7:15 AM - 8:00 AM, Basic Freestyle necessary, capacity 30), a Girls Beginners Camp (5:30 PM - 6:15 PM, capacity 30), and a Boys Beginner Camp (7:00 PM - 7:45 PM, capacity 30). Each session costs Rs 100/-. Registration is required via Google Forms.
extendedProps.contact: Meet Vanja, Institute Aquatics Secretary - 9323587701; Rajwardhan Toraskar, General Secretary, Sports Affairs, IIT Bombay - +91 9619000065

title: Book Issuance from Technology Lending Library (Book Bank)

extendedProps.description: The Central Library is issuing books from the Technology Lending Library (Book Bank) to UG students. Eligibility criteria vary for economically weaker section students (parents' income below taxable limit or eligible for MCM Scholarship) and general category students. Eligible students can borrow 5 books for Rs. 51/-, and general category students can borrow remaining books for Rs. 91/-. Books must be returned by the end of the semester. Students must carry a valid Institute Identity Card.

title: Book Issuance from Book Bank for SC/ST Students

extendedProps.description: Central Library has a facility to issue 5 text books per semester from the Book Bank to eligible SC/ST undergraduate students. These books must be returned before the end of the semester. Students whose names appear in the list of SC/ST students received from the Academic Office are eligible. Please carry your valid Institute Identity Card.

title: Seed Stars 2025: IITB Track - Unlock Funding Opportunities

extendedProps.description: Seed Stars is a 3 month long cohort which brings together India's top pre-seed and seed-stage startups with leading VCs and institutional investors. As a dynamic funding arena, it offers live pitches, rich mentorship opportunities, cohort programs and direct investor engagement. This exclusive track is designed to spotlight startups from IIT Bombay, giving you a powerful stage to: Pitch to top-tier VCs and Investors, 4-week intensive cohort with industry experts, Access flexible funding on your own terms, Gain hands-on mentorship from industry leaders, Expand your network across India's startup ecosystem, Boost your startup's credibility with the IITB tag.
